poem:
### The Shadows We Cast

Jet shadow like clock hands  
over sun-drenched soil;  
a symphony of echoes  
on desert's parchment page.  
Black wings whip the silence,  
drag stars to their knees,  
and in the loam of dust  
six seeds lose their name,  
their stories burned into dusk,  
while clockwork skies spin on.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Israel also killed at least six senior Iranian nuclear scientists and a number of senior Iranian officials, including its most senior military officer". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
